Address: 570 Eccles Ave, South San Francisco, CA 94080, USA
Description:
Our planet is facing a changing climate and running out of farmable land just when we need it most. To feed a growing population, we need a whole new approach to farming. That’s where Plenty® comes in.

Compared to conventional farming, our Compton farm…
- Has the potential to save millions of gallons of water per year
- Can produce up to 350x more leafy greens per acre
- Can grow an entire soccer field worth of produce in the size of a goal

By growing vertically indoors, Plenty® is able to dramatically reduce the natural resources required to farm at a commercial scale while also making it possible to grow where we used to think it was impossible, like in the center of a city or the middle of the desert.

We are a fresh food company farming with the future in mind. We build and operate sustainable greenhouses across America, growing delicious leafy greens and herbs that are always in season. We deliver our greens quickly after being harvested so they’re always fresh tasting, long-lasting and as nutritious as possible.

Our farms are unconventional. But so is our commitment to taste, quality and sustainability.

Address: 2075 N Twin Oaks Valley Rd, San Marcos, CA 92069, USA
Description:
Why We Exist
We exist to make food safer, higher-quality, sustainable, and accessible to all.

What We Do 
We build and operate high-tech greenhouses with the purpose of providing local communities with fresh, sustainable leafy greens.

Our Core Values
1. We prioritize food safety, quality and then customers.
2. We put the team's success above any individual’s
3. We don’t accept good. We only accept great.

What Makes Us Different
We unify our passion for building leaders with our passion for science and innovation. The result is a unique culture where we cultivate personal growth in order to push our team to create meaningful positive impact in the world around us.

How We Got Started
We were founded in 2009 in Pierre Jr.'s dorm room while studying computer science at UC Riverside. Inspired by his dad to become an entrepreneur and by a college professor conducting hydroponic research for NASA, Pierre became committed to reinventing agriculture here on earth. Pierre raised a little money from his parents, friends, and family to build a prototype farm while also taking on his Masters in Business from UC San Diego's Rady School of Management. In this environment, our young founder met investors who believed in his vision and invested in Go Green.

Address: 2651 Cabrillo Highway North, Half Moon Bay, CA 94019, USA
Description: As one of the nation’s leading innovators in horticulture, Rocket Farms stands at the forefront of quality and sustainability. Our commitment to excellence and environmental stewardship has established us as a major player in the industry, boasting some of the largest and most advanced cultivation facilities. From blooming to culinary herbs, we are committed to growing a brighter future.

Houweling’s Tomatoes is a world-renowned greenhouse tomato grower with facilities in Delta, BC. Founded by Cornelius Houweling and now led by his son Casey, Houweling’s is dedicated to delivering a full complement of scrumptious tomatoes and cucumbers, while constantly innovating to reduce its environmental footprint.

Located just 30 minutes apart, our Carpinteria and Oxnard facilities have been production powerhouses since 1970, supplying fresh, living greens nationwide for decades. While both locations focus on living greens, our Oxnard facility is renowned for producing our highly sought-after organic varieties.

Our story began in the Salinas Valley, affectionately called America’s Salad Bowl. It was here, where Bruce Taylor followed in the footsteps of his father and grandfather and became the third generation to work in the fresh produce business.

In 1995, Bruce and several partners founded Taylor Fresh Foods. A new company with a new vision was born – to be North America’s favorite maker of salads and healthy fresh foods.

Address: 9440 Santa Monica Boulevard Suite 301, Beverly Hills CA 90210

Description:
Bring the rainforest home.
Our mission is to grow plants that bring joy to our customers. We have airplants for sale, tropical outdoor plants, staghorn ferns, and many other houseplants and outdoor plants for sale online and at our showroom.

The story of California Greenhouses began when Mark and Carol Stansbury started selling interior foliage plants out of their small van in the spring of 1973. The Stansburys would load their van full of plants purchased from a greenhouse in Pico Rivera and then peddle them throughout Orange and San Diego counties to retail nurseries.

The first nursery opened by the Stansburys was in Santa Ana Heights, California in 1980. Two years later they opened their doors at a new location in Cardiff, San Diego. The first nursery has since outgrown its original location and has moved a number of times, settling, for the past 20 years, in beautiful Irvine.  Our San Diego location has remained in the same location for over 30 years.

The complete operation now consists of over 165,000 s/f of greenhouses in four locations and is incorporated as California Greenhouses. Since 1980 their primary focus has been to present the professional interiorscape industry with the finest plants, containers, and accessories available. We have learned over the years that interiorscapers have a strong vision and are truly creating living works of art. Our job is to help facilitate the artist in anyway possible.

Address: 17971 Sky Park Cir E, Irvine, CA 92614
Description:
Malaia's Microgreens first began it's story in the Shed.

Leaky roof. Uneven floors. Somehow too hot AND too cold.

Nevertheless, this was where we first earned our Farmer's Certificate and the home to our very first crops.

Everde Growers is a leader within the horticulture industry with a true coast-to-coast footprint consisting of over 6,700 acres in production encompassing 15 farm locations throughout Texas, Florida, California, and Oregon. Our superior growing methods and pruning practices ensure consistent high quality and availability. Our inventory mix includes trees, shrubs, perennials, palms, grasses, succulents, tropicals, fruit, and many other items.

Cordova Gardens is an Encinitas, North County,  family owned and operated, retail and delivery garden center, boasting 2 beautiful acres of colorful, healthy plant nursery grounds. Our garden and nursery center specializes in outdoor tropical plants, drought tolerant succulents, pottery, fountains, statuary, birdbaths, tables benches, and more; we maintain the largest inventory of plants and garden art in North County, San Diego.

Name of Facility: Jungle Music Palms, Cycads and Tropical Plants
Description: Jungle Music is a family owned palm tree, cycad and tropical plant nursery established in 1977 to provide the most rare and beautiful plants anywhere!  Our Nursery location is off Freeway 5 in Encinitas, CA, north of San Diego.

Jim Stakey Greenhouses is a family wholesale business selling only the highest quality plants grown in our facility. We partner with premier suppliers in the industry to enhance quality and performance of our plants. We offer a wide range of unique selections from rooted cuttings to baby seedlings,  Our availability includes bedding plants, herbs, mono & multi-culture planters, baskets and pots.

For over 60 years, Kartuz Greenhouses has been offering distinctive varieties of rare and exotic plants. Begonias, gesneriads, hoyas and passionflowers comprise our key specialties. Among the many listings in these plant families are promising new introductions and excellent miniature varieties. In addition to our own hybrids, we also list the finest new varieties from other leading hybridizers.

For 50 years, Olive Hill Greenhouses has provided exceptional quality plants for homes, offices and indoor landscapes.

We specialize in Anthuriums, Bromeliads and tropical foliage.
Rote Greenhouses is a grower of quality tropical foliage.

It started as a hobby, a passion for plants, in a Los Angeles backyard in 1975. Today, we’re the largest commercial grower in the United States, and that same passion for plants guides everything we do.

The largest grower and supplier of over 500 microgreens,
edible flowers & specialty items in the USA.

Simple Seed Farms was established in 2019, operating out of a garage in the heart of Fountain Valley, California. We specialize in indoor hydroponic technology that helps farmers simplify their farm operations across Orange County. As a farm, we supply the freshest microgreens to over 60 local businesses. 

Today, we are based in our own warehouse in Stanton, CA. We are building a team of amazing farmers with a wide variety of skill sets. We hope to continue pursuing our mission through dedication and teamwork.

Address: 1077 N. Willow Ave. Ste. 105 PMB 12, Fresno, FRESNO, California
580 Linne Rd. Suite 150, Paso Robles, California
Description:
At Zeste Farms™, we’re on a mission to change the world with our indoor growing system. Our name, Zeste, represents our promise for fresh, flavorful, and nutritious living greens. 

For over 10 years, we’ve been growing and selling over 14 leafy greens and 6 herbs to chefs, grocers, and consumers along the California 101 corridor. Now, we’re evolving with a highly efficient and scalable indoor vertical farming concept that eliminates the green premium.

Plant Culture Systems team has over 70 combined years of knowledge in Agricultural Technology in soilless culture controlled environment agriculture plant culture systems across over 300 crops, internet of things sensing, and artificial intelligence.

Address: 1196 S San Antonio Ave, Pomona CA 91766
Description: Sarvodaya Institute works and operates on unceded and occupied Tongva land (also known as Pomona, CA).  We acknowledge and offer our deepest thanks to the Tongva people for the centuries of care and love they offered to this beautiful land we now call home. Our greatest hope is to learn from our indigenous family and return to the beautiful relationship between people and land we all deserve.

Empowering Farming Growth
with Sustainable, Affordable Hydroponics

We are a microfarm/market garden in the city of Norco, California.

Our primary goal is to educate the public while providing a large selection of healthy, low-cost fruit and vegetable plants at the correct time of year for home food production. And we also sell great tasting lettuce (heads and salad mix)!

Huerta del Valle is a nonprofit grassroots organization serving the Inland Empire region of Southern California, a network of urban farms and community gardens working for an equitable food system to provide healthy organic produce for all.

Premium AAA Cannabis For The Recreational Market
The Cat City Cannabis Campus was planned in two phases and has been designed to comply with cGMP standards.

Phase One includes 247,000 sqft of canopy with 78,000 sqft of header house and breezeway for a total of 325,000 sqft. We are able to produce 111,000 pounds per year of dry cannabis at capacity, with an additional 22,000 pounds per year of associated trim.

Phase Two will increase our facility by 168,000 sqft and increase production by approximately 50,000 pounds per year of dry cannabis and approximately 11,000 pounds per year of associated trim.

Producer of strawberries intended to transform the way strawberries are grown and marketed. The company uses technology in farming enabling customers to obtain flavored strawberries at an affordable price.
Producer of bockchoy in 2 acres of high tunnels.

Revol Greens has Midwestern roots.  

In 2017, we opened our first greenhouse in Minnesota, a place known for its cold, snowy winters, where the thought of producing fresh produce year-round seemed impossible. The magic of a greenhouse, though, is that we can grow delicious lettuce and greens 365 days per year. Anywhere.    

We have expanded our network to include three additional greenhouses in California, Georgia and Texas. 

With an experienced growing team, state-of the-art greenhouses and innovative agricultural practices, Revol Greens is paving the way to a more sustainable future.
